articles.description: Paris St-Germain and France striker Kylian Mbappe is set to receive a £128m signing-on bonus and earn almost £13m a year.
articles.title: PSG striker Mbappe agrees to join Real

articles.description: Former Germany defender Andreas Brehme, who scored the winning goal in the 1990 World Cup final, dies aged 63.
articles.title: Germany World Cup winner Brehme dies aged 63

articles.description: Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp says forward Diogo Jota faces "months" out with a knee injury he sustained in the win at Brentford on Saturday.
articles.title: Jota faces 'months' out with knee injury - Klopp

articles.description: Marseille sack Italian manager Gennaro Gattuso just five months after his arrival at the Ligue 1 outfit.
articles.title: Marseille sack Gattuso after less than five months

articles.description: The Rugby Football Union considered selling Twickenham and buying a 50% share in Wembley, according to a document seen by the BBC.
articles.title: RFU debated Twickenham sale and Wembley shares

articles.description: The 29th season of Major League Soccer is set to be one of the most significant in the history of the North American league.
articles.title: Welcome to Messi League Soccer - Leo mania hits USA

articles.description: The new format will see long jumps measured in a take-off zone rather than the traditional wooden board.
articles.title: World Athletics planning to trial new format for long jump take-offs

articles.description: Napoli sack manager Walter Mazzarri after just three months in charge and replace him Slovakia boss Francesco Calzona.
articles.title: Napoli sack manager Mazzarri and appoint Calzona

articles.description: Scotland are no longer Calcutta Cup underdogs and "happy to carry the favourites tag", says former England captain Matt Dawson.
articles.title: Scotland no longer Calcutta Cup underdogs - Dawson

articles.description: Ireland expect to have Caelan Doris available for Saturday's Six Nations game against Wales after the back row missed training on Tuesday.
articles.title: Ireland expect Doris to be fit to face Wales
